attributes.comment:
I feel is it unnecessary to increase the fees as proposed by the US Citization and
Imigration Services in docket number USCIS-2006-0044. Adoption is such an
expensive process and for most families, like us, that money is usually not
something that is just sitting around waiting to be used. It is hard earned and
carefully allotted for each step along the way. Up to this point, filing with US CIS
was one of the most expensive, and timely, steps we had to go through which was
somewhat disappointing. In addition to this, families like ours who choose to adopt
from China are being forced to file with US CIS a second time because the 18
month expiration period is not long enough to fulfill the current referral time frames.
It's one thing to file once, but to pay that amount of money plus what is now being
proposed in addition to the standard fee a second time is outrageous. That extra
money needs to be used for necessities such as cribs, car seats, high chairs and
other items to care for a child. In my opinion, it is not a necessity to charge extra
for an already expensive process.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Denis N. Ammons
